35 Greg Spiess

Historical

Summary

Biography

2013: Named to the GLIAC All-Academic Team ... appeared in 10 games and made five starts ... went 2-3 with a 6.04 ERA over 28.1 innings with 27 strikeouts ... tossed a complete game against Charleston on March 13, allowing just one run ... secured the win with a scoreless frame against SVSU in the GLIAC Tournament on May 8, including two strikeouts ... tossed two scoreless innings on May 5 against GVSU with three strikeouts .... struck out a career-high seven batters over six innings on April 9 at Urbana ... started GLIAC Tournament game against GVSU on May 10 and struck out two over 3.2 innings ...Game-By-Game Stats.

2012: Made 13 appearances including nine starts … debuted March 6 vs. Urbana, tossing two scoreless innings in relief … picked up his first win April 1 at Tiffin, allowing two earned runs in 6.2 innings … won consecutive decisions April 15 at Ohio Dominican and April 21 vs. Ashland, the latter being a two-hit shutout which earned him GLIAC Player of the Week honors … pitched in two games in the GLIAC Tournament ...Game-By-Game Stats.

2011 (Jackson CC): Posted a 5-2 record with a 2.78 ERA and a team-best 53 strikeouts in 12 games (55 innings) … received Academic All-Conference honors.

2010 (Jackson CC): Went 5-2 with a 2.17 ERA in 54 innings … struck out 35 in 12 games pitched.

High School: Graduated from Saline in 2009 … played two years of varsity baseball for the Hornets, who finished as the state runner-up both seasons … was a Dream Team and all-state selection as well as all-conference, all-district and all-region … threw a no-hitter senior year … was an honor roll student and graduated from Saline with honors.

Personal: Full name--Gregory L. Spiess … born in Ann Arbor … son of Robert and Karen Spiess … has two brothers, Robby and Ryan … is a civil engineering major ... named to the Coach's Honor Roll (term gpa 3.0-3.49) for Winter 2012.
